Status: Game finished. Role PMs & Mod-Notes here


"EUREKA!" you hear somebody shrieking in an ecstatic voice from the laboratory next door. "I'VE DONE IT! IT'S FINISHED! I'VE PROVED IT!"

You all rush to the laboratory. There, awaiting you with an exhausted but excited face is Professor Alan Gebra, head of your mathematical research team. Old and decrepid physically, yet in his exhiliration he has taken on a youthful spirit. His white whispy hair quivers with excitement, as he clutches with trembling hands some sheets of A4 lined paper. His shirt and lab coat are soaked with sweat.

He stares at you all with a glazed over look in his eyes, the feeling of anticipation building in the room. "THIS IS THE MOMENT WE HAVE BEEN WORKING TOWARDS FOR OVER THREE DECADES!" he yells hysterically. "AND I HOLD IT IN MY HANDS, THE PINACCLE OF MY CAREER! THE PROOF TO THE RIEMANN HYPOTHESIS!"

Some of you break down in tears of joy, others of you rush to smother the professor with hugs. Screams of joy echo through the room. You, the professor's research team, have been through thick and thin with him, ups and downs, and all in a quest to prove a hypothesis. But this isn't just any hypothesis; this is the Riemann Hypothesis, a problem plaguing mathematicians for over 150 years.

But somewhere in the room there is a pang of regret. Ultimately, you're just the professor's research team. Expendable. Disposable. Irrelevant. Professor Alan Gebra will be the one who scoops the plaudits, while you're left to while the rest of your days away on the Internet (playing Mafia, no doubt).

Yet as you all retire to bed, there is an overriding sense of triumph and achievement.

Perhaps foolishly so.

For as you lie snuggly tucked up in your bed, Professor Gebra tosses and turns in his sleep. His mind is restless; there's something he's forgotten. Mentally he goes over his proof. He's checked it, double-checked it, triple-checked it...

He sits up in alarm as he hears movement outside his door.
His door!
In his excitement, he didn't lock it! The movement draws nearer. The proof, they're after his proof! As his door swings open and the light from outside floods in, he grabs the proof off his bedside desk and grasps it to his chest like a mother protecting her baby, scrambling as far away from the door as he can within the confines of his room. He squints as a shadowy blob enters the room. One person? Two? Three? More? He can't tell - his glasses are lying on his bedside desk.

Laughter fills the room, and a blur of sounds swim around the professor's ears. "You won't be needing that proof where you're going, old man."

The shadows envelope him, and as the professor slumps to the floor, lifeless, his grip on his proof, his life's work, is relinquished, and it flutters to the floor peacefully, as if unaware of the atrocities just committed.



Professor Al Gebra,
Vanilla Townie
, killed pre-game!



The next day, there is a hushed awe as you all gather around the bloodied, vacant corpse of the professor. It's only later that one of you thinks to look for the proof - but it's gone. No trace of it remains.

But who would do such a thing?

You look around you. Your colleagues all seem to be doing the same thing, and there is a nervous shuffling of feet.

You see somebody raising their arm towards you, and they're holding a pistol! Suddenly, there's a flash of light, and a loud bang. Your arms fly instinctively to your face and you scream in terror.

You don't know how long you scream for, but at some point you realise you're still alive. You cautiously lower your arms, and look around you. You're the only one in the room. The pistol and the gunshot... were they
imaginary?
It all looked and sounded so
real
...

Who can you trust? They could all be killers, conspiring against you! You need to kill them first! ... No, you're just being
irrational
now. This is a
complex
issue... But now you're making mathematical puns in your head... and, as the saying goes, that's the first
sine
of madness.

  1. Fundamental


  2. The site-wide rules apply, please read them and don't do anything stupid.
  3. Play to win.
  4. Unless it is explicitly stated in your role PM that you can do so, do not talk about this game outside of the game thread.
  5. Do not quote your role PM. Do not quote from any mod-provided private QT. Both these will result in modkill and auto-loss. Depending on the circumstance, you may be able to paraphrase things. Use common sense and if you are unsure feel free to ask me via PM.
  6. Be courteous to your fellow player. This is just a game - please don't bring personal grudges into the game. Try and keep it civil. If you cross 'the line' I'll step in. Said line will be judged by me.
    7. Voting, Lynching & Death
  7. For your vote to be counted, it must be bold, and in the form
    Vote: Al Gebra
    . Caps and colons are optional, but it does need to be bolded. The VOTE: tags are also appropriate for voting.
    1. If it looks like a vote (including broken tags), I will probably count it as a vote (and fix tags if necessary). If you have any doubt, then make a double-post with the fixed tags. Mispellings or shortened names are accepted as long as it is clear who you are voting. If I can't tell who you are attempting to vote, it won't count.
  8. Unvotes are
    not
    necessary before placing a new vote, but appreciated by me. Please bold your unvotes or use the unvote tags. It is not necessary to name the player you are unvoting.
  9. A lynch will occur when a player achieves a majority of votes. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight. Night will begin as soon as I have declared the lynch. All players alive prior to the hammer (including the player being lynched) may continue to post in the thread until I declare the lynch.
    1. Majority needed for a lynch is calculated as follows: (n/2) + 1 votes [with '(n/2)' rounded down], where
      n
      is the
      number of players alive
      .
    2. For example, with 9 players alive it takes (4) + 1 = 5 votes to lynch [as 9/2 is rounded down].
      With 6 players alive it takes (3) + 1 = 4 votes to lynch.
  10. You may vote for a no lynch if desired. A No Lynch still requires a majority of players to vote for it. Once achieved, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
  11. Once you're dead, you are dead... however, you may make one 'bah' post of
    no more than four words
    . 'Bah' posts may only contain the following words (in any order/combination):
    12. Spoiler: The Bah Post Rule in Detail
      • Bah
      • Sorry
      • Go
      • Town
      • I
      • You
      • All
      • Suck
      • Rock
      • Avocado


    2. Punctuation/capitalisation may be used as you deem appropiate. If I feel you are intentionally trying to be a prat, I may disallow it though.
    3. You are allowed to use words that can be derived from or are slight alterations of words on the list of accepted words.
    4. If in doubt, check your 'Bah' post with me via PM before posting it. Any 'Bah' posts that I deem to be unacceptable will be replaced with 'I SUCK AVOCADOS!'
    Activity & Deadlines
  12. Treat this game as a commitment, and try your best to stay active.
  13. Prods will be issued after 48 hours in a row without posting. I will force-replace players as I feel necessary if I am having to repeatedly prod them. Players may request a prod on another player in the following format:
    Mod: Please prod <playername>
    . This is only to be done if a player has gone without posting for 48 hours and I have missed prodding them.
    1. If you do not post in-thread within 48 hours of a prod I will begin looking for a replacement. You may reclaim your spot if you return before I find a replacement.
  14. Things come up in life, if you need time off for something, please let myself and the players know in-thread for V/LA purposes. I will be flexible, but if you can't be here for a significant amount of time (as judged by myself at the time) I will have replace you for the sake of the game.
  15. The default deadline for each game day will be 2 weeks. Nights will last 72 hours.
  16. In the event of a deadline ending without a player gaining a majority of votes, there will be no lynch. No pluralities for lynching.
  17. Deadlines will only be extended if I need a number of replacements, or barring some other freak circumstances. Apart from that, laziness, or anything else, will not result in a deadline extension.
    18. Other Information
  18. This is my colour and font I will use for modly purposes
    . All other colours are fair game as long as they are easily read by your other players/myself and do not look similar to my paticular shade (as judged by myself), just don't post a rainbow.
  19. Any night actions will be resolved using Natural Action Resolution.
  20. I will try to post Vote Counts as often as possible. If you feel a vote count is needed, don't hesitate to ask for one, and I'll provide one at the next opportunity.
    1. If there seem to be mistakes on the Vote Counts, don't hesitate to correct me. I am awesome but not infallible.
  21. It's more than possible I've missed a rule or haven't completely covered something. If I believe that you are intentionally exploiting the game in this way, you will be either force-replaced or mod-killed depending on what I judge to be the severity of the offence.
  22. I reserve the right to add more, or modify existing rules at any time. If this happens, I will let everyone know. (This paticular rule will not be modified.)
  23. Flavour in night/day write up's is just that; flavour. It has no bearing on and does not reflect the setup/roles/actions/choices. As such, speculation on this will be publically mocked.
  24. No cryptography.
  25. Have fun!

The kind of person that selfvotes as scum generally (probably) wouldn't argue that it's not a bad move as scum, as that would make them look conspicuous and the point of an RVS selfvote as scum is to make yourself look like town (or wifom) while there is still little risk of pressure. I would expect a scum whose selfvote accrued more votes to go "whoa, whoa" and unvote, possibly followed by accusations on the people that voted for them.

Regardless, I definitely want to see the answer to don's question.

Alright so I'm reading now after skimming, but I have something to say to implosion. You're trying to use a null hypothesis to lynch me? That's not very logically sound. For those of you who don't know, a null hypothesis is a way to determine something by eliminating all other possibilities. Let's say that I think "X caused Y." But there's no way to prove that "X caused Y." But I can try to determine that "nothing but X caused Y" which is a null hypothesis. It's impossible to actually prove one; it can either be disproven or not disproven.

Anyway, here's my plan:

Oopidstay should investigate don_johnson tonight.
Why? Well, first of all, if he is scum we want to catch him early. He's going to be pivotal in the nightgame. After don, he should investigate juls then morthas. Actually, possibly morthas then juls. If I'm not lynched today, he should investigate me or don tonight. The downside is the possibility of don dying, but I discuss this below. There is a specific reason, which is the fact that don's role could be confirmable.


Claims
:

VT - implosion, juls, plague.
Jailkeeper - don
Cop - oopid
Neighbor - morthas
waiting - TS

After I'm lynched, don has a few jailing choices. He shouldn't jail morthas or oopid. He should jail a vanilla townie claim,
who he announces before the lynch today.
We'll assume two mafia. So, at this point there are two obvious possibilities. Either someone will or no one will die at night. This dichotomy is illustrated below:

If there is no nightkill
- lynch the person that don jailed. Don declares another target and jails them. At this point in the game, the living claims would be (assuming TS VT claim):

Jailkeeper, cop, neighbor, 3 VT claims (juls plague TS)

You'll lynch the VT claim that don jailed. Lets say it's plague for simplicity, and that he declares he'll jail TS:

Jailkeeper, cop, neighbor, VT, jailed VT going into night.

At this point, we again see the dichotomy of there being or not being a kill. IF THERE IS NO KILL, there will be 5 alive and probably a mislynch. That mislynch should be used on the jailed. If they flip town, the living claims will be: VT, jk, cop, neighbor. At this point, the cop should have investigated don and gotten town (if they got mafia, don should be dead by now). At this point,
don would jail oopidstay.
If don died, the VT would be scum. If oopid died, don would be scum. If the vanilla townie died, don would be scum. If no one dies OR if the neighbor dies, then there's a very simple test to determine scum. Ask oopid if he was roleblocked. If he was roleblocked, this means that don is role confirmed and is likely not a godfather, meaning the innocent on him can be trusted - furthermore, since he was roleblocked, he can't be scum. So if the cop confirms being roleblocked, lynch the VT. If the cop denies it, lynch don, since the cop is clear from having been blocked. That all works if the neighbor died. If no one died, ask the same question. If he agrees that he was blocked, don is essentially clear. Lynch the cop, jail the vanilla townie, lynch the vanilla townie. If the cop denies being blocked, then either don is a gambiting godfather or oopid is scum. At this point, the vanilla townie and the neighbor would have to figure out who's scum between don and oopid.

If there is a nightkill - treat the person that don jailed as confirmed town. They are unless it's 3 scum. If it is 3 scum and no nightkills, by the way, don and oopid could very well both be scum. A jailkeeper would not make sense in that situation (protection would be useless) and a cop would break the game - unless there's a godfather, which is also possible.

Anyway, back to the plan. If there's a nightkill, it would almost definitely fall on a power role claim. If oopid is nightkilled: you have essentially confirmed innocents in the jailkeep target and the neighbor, which would hopefully be enough to win. If don is nightkilled: oopid would have wasted a night investigation. You still have confirmed innocents in morthas and [jailkeep target], though, which would hopefully be enough. If morthas is nightkilled: don's jailkept VT is clear. If oopid investigated don and got town, you can use the above method of lynching a vanilla townie claim and having don jailkeep oopid to try to role-confirm himself. If don dies, 2 clears out of 3 players. If oopid died, don would be lying scum. So either there would be a counterclaim or town would win.

At this point, basically, if TS claims VT and the scum isn't in {Oopid, don} we're in VERY good shape. If TS claims a power role, then that gives us even MORE to work with, which would be awesome.

The above plan in short:

Every day, don needs to declare who he's going to jail before there is a lynch. Once the game goes down to four players going into night, or possibly even earlier, don can jail oopid to role-confirm himself, since it's unlikely that an individual mafioso would be both a godfather and a roleblocker or jailkeeper. It isn't impossible, but it's relatively unlikely. If oopid denies it, there will be a counter-claim. The downside is that the plan makes several assumptions, including:

-morthas is town.
-the mafia is not immune to roleblocking or protection.

The upside is that it doesn't assume that the mafia isn't a godfather. If the above assumptions are true, then the plan has close to sure success if oopid and don are both town. Otherwise, they'll probably wind up as counterclaimants.

Mod-Notes/Thoughts/Excuses


Spoiler: Setup
Town have two great power roles in the Cop and the Jailkeeper, and Mafia have nothing. Town has a lot of investigative power, and had the Mafia just been Goons (which they essentially are) the setup is pretty stacked against the Mafia. I knew town was powerful, but man, I didn't realise just how powerful they were until we got underway.

However, as was alluded to in my review (by the Normal Game Review Group), town needs power due to the... well, for now, let's say 'shock' nature of the setup. To quote Hoopla:
Hoopla wrote:You might receive a little criticism post-game from duped townies for the slightly bastard-like element of two scum neighbours. I only say bastard as it's completely unexpected from the way meta is currently. It's a perfectly possible and fine role combination, just unexpected. Which is why I think you need decent amount of confirming town power to narrow the pool of possible scumpartners for town in late game.


But, really, I think odds were stacked against the scum-team. Obviously Kalofer dying Day 1 didn't help a great deal, but as it emerged later in the game town had sufficient power to just be able to map out Night Actions and plan for (almost) any outcome. So, alleged bastard-mod shenanigans aside (which I'll get to later) this really is a town-sided setup.

Spoiler: Actual Play
don_johnson played the Jailkeeper very well. Stopping 2 NKs early-game was amazing, and was probably the major, major factor in the eventual Mafia loss (town-sided setup aside, Morthas was pretty much getting a free ride until it was PoE'd down to Morthas-scum).

Oopidstay also had reasonable targets. Although, really, the fact that the people he investigated (Twistedspoon, theplague42) were percieved as scummy detracted from their usefulness, because it pretty much was "Well, cop investigated this guy and he turned up innocent - but this guy is so scummy, he's got to be a Godfather!"

Obviously I'm biased, but I wasn't a fan of how people went "Yeah, well, Morthas isn't scum because the Mod is wrong when he says Morthas could be scum and if Morthas is scum I will RAGE POST-GAME RAWR". Given how I'd made it clear Morthas could be scum, the way people promptly ignored that (to make a point about how the setup was bastardly?) was disappointing.

The worst people were the people who made the above point without then backing it up. Juls, while (incorrectly) ruling out the Mafia Neighbour 2-man Neighbourhood, at least had a reason for doing it (although I think it's wrong as I'll explain later), but there were people who just went "YEAH IT WOULD TOTALLY BE BASTARDLY" without any obvious reasoning.

Spoiler: OMG 2 MAFIA NEIGHBOURS YOU BASTAAAAARD /rage
The game was approved by my reviewers for normalcy and balance
so blame them, not me!
, and I personally agree with the decision completely (obviously if I thought it was unfairly bastardly I wouldn't have suggested it in the first place).

What I just quoted from Hoopla is still applicable in this section so I'll quote it again:
Hoopla wrote:You might receive a little criticism post-game from duped townies for the slightly bastard-like element of two scum neighbours. I only say bastard as it's completely unexpected from the way meta is currently. It's a perfectly possible and fine role combination, just unexpected.

And I wholeheartedly agree with that assessment.

The main case I could see was Juls'. I'll re-quote it here:
Juls wrote:I have talked to the mod about this and plan on addressing it with the normal review committee after but the normal roles explicitly states that
Scum masons are disallowed
. I know what Hoopla said, and I know what the mod says but I am going to go based on the assumption that scum masons cannot be allowed and therefore Morthas is town. If it turns out to be different then I will certainly not be a happy camper after the game.
Juls wrote:Calling them neighbors would just be semantics because obviously in a 9 person game you would only have one scum team which basically makes them Scum Masons. How exactly would they be alignment unconfirmed as both scum?

I believe this is a bad interpretation of the Normal Game Guidelines.

I agree more with what implosion said:
implosion wrote:Masons are alignment-confirmed neighbors. I see what you mean, but the term mason only applies to pro-town roles. And regardless, Kalofer flipped neighbor.

I get that your argument is that if Morthas was also scum, they would be called masons and not neighbors (at least i think that's what you're saying) but masons are strictly pro-town afaik. Actually, I shouldn't say that since I was in a scum-mason group once, but we didn't know we were scum and it was a theme SO. In normal terms, i'm pretty sure masons have to be town.

This is kind of no true scotsman, but masons are generally thought of as a group of players who are all town and all know that each other are town. Neighbors are a group of players who can night-talk, and that's the only special thing about that group of players. They could, theoretically, be alignment-confirmed to each other for reasons outside the neighborhood (like having one be a cop and investigate another, or having two neighbors be scum together and just using the "neighbor" designation to indicate that they can chat).

It's still unlikely, but I don't think it's impossible.


Why?

Well, 'Scum Masons' is generally used to talk about the case where you have a group of Masons, but one of them is Mafia.

Which is without a doubt bastardly, as the Masons are under the impression they're all confirmed to be town to each other but they're actually not.

Neighbours, being derived from Masons (who are confirmed to be pro-town) make more sense in that Neighbours are unconfirmed to be pro-town, rather than unconfirmed to be the same alignment.

Taking the stance that the two Mafia Neighbours, who being confirmed in alignment to each other, are actually Mafia Masons, means that I would bet a whole lot of ongoing Normal games are by the same logic bastardly.

Because, really, under that logic, any scum-group are Mafia Masons and therefore bastardly. They have a QT, they're confirmed in alignment to each other. It would be semantics to argue that because they don't have the 'Neighbour' tagline that they can't be Mafia Masons. Therefore, the only Mafia groups permissible to each other would be when they don't have a QT (and arguably don't know who each other are).

This is obviously wrong, which is where Juls' logic messes up.

With the bastardly semantics ruled out, that leaves the possibly bastardly nature of people not expecting 2 Mafia Neigbours in a 2-Man Neighbourhood as a possibility. Which is fair enough, but then I clearly said that it was possible (and you should therefore expect it as a possibility).


Overall, while obviously I don't like being called a bastard
*
, I enjoyed modding this and I hope you enjoyed playing, even if you do feel I have been bastardly.
